PropertyList.text:
This is an experimental model representing the earlier Mig-29 9-12 aircraft. All settings and procedures are best-guess.
Flaps extend to 20 degrees, with 4 positions: 3.2, 6.4, 12.8, 20
Extend leading edge slats for better performance at higher angles of attack at the expense of increased drag.
Reheat engages at 90% throttle or greater.
Takeoff : flaps 1/4 maintain slight down elevator until rotation rotation at ~150 kts retract gear at ~220 kts retract flaps at ~240 kts Approach : flaps 1/4 below 240 kts extend gear below 220 kts flaps 1/2 below 200 kts flaps 3/4 below 170 kts flaps full below 150 kts Landing : Optimal touch down at around 155 kts (250km/hour) AoA 10-11 degrees
Dorsal intake vents open and main intake screens close upon main gear compression (weight on wheels). This is meant to prevent foreign object ingestion, as the Mig-29 like many Russian aircraft was designed to operate from rough fields.
